bigthetaoga.cell_methods: area: mean where sea time: mean
bigthetaoga.comment: Diagnostic should be contributed only for models using conservative temperature as prognostic field.
bigthetaoga.long_name: Global Average Sea Water Conservative Temperature

evs.cell_methods: area: mean where ice_free_sea over sea time: mean
evs.comment: computed as the total mass of water vapor evaporating from the ice-free portion of the ocean  divided by the area of the ocean portion of the grid cell.
evs.long_name: Water Evaporation Flux Where Ice Free Ocean over Sea

fgcfc11.cell_methods: area: mean where sea time: mean

fgcfc12.cell_methods: area: mean where sea time: mean

fgsf6.cell_methods: area: mean where sea time: mean

ficeberg2d.cell_methods: area: mean where sea time: mean
ficeberg2d.comment: computed as the iceberg melt water  flux into the ocean divided by the area of the ocean portion of the grid cell.
ficeberg2d.long_name: Water Flux into Sea Water from Icebergs

flandice.cell_methods: area: mean where sea time: mean
flandice.comment: Computed as the water flux into the ocean due to land ice (runoff water from surface and base of land ice or melt from base of ice shelf or vertical ice front) into the ocean divided by the area ocean portion of the grid cell
flandice.long_name: Water Flux into Sea Water from Land Ice

friver.cell_methods: area: mean where sea time: mean
friver.comment: computed as the river flux of water into the ocean divided by the area of the ocean portion of the grid cell.
friver.long_name: Water Flux into Sea Water from Rivers

fsitherm.cell_methods: area: mean where sea time: mean
fsitherm.comment: computed as the sea ice thermodynamic water flux into the ocean divided by the area of the ocean portion of the grid cell.
fsitherm.long_name: Water Flux into Sea Water Due to Sea Ice Thermodynamics

hfcorr.cell_methods: area: mean where sea time: mean
hfcorr.comment: Flux correction is also called 'flux adjustment'. A positive flux correction is downward i.e. added to the ocean. In accordance with common usage in geophysical disciplines, 'flux' implies per unit area, called 'flux density' in physics.

hfds.cell_methods: area: mean where sea time: mean
hfds.comment: This is the net flux of heat entering the liquid water column through its upper surface (excluding any 'flux adjustment') .
hfds.long_name: Downward Heat Flux at Sea Water Surface

hfevapds.cell_methods: area: mean where ice_free_sea over sea time: mean
hfevapds.comment: This is defined as 'where ice_free_sea over sea'
hfevapds.long_name: Temperature Flux Due to Evaporation Expressed as Heat Flux out of Sea Water

hfgeou.cell_methods: area: mean where sea time: mean
hfgeou.comment: Upward geothermal heat flux per unit area on the sea floor
hfgeou.long_name: Upward Geothermal Heat Flux at Sea Floor

hfibthermds2d.cell_methods: area: mean where sea time: mean
hfibthermds2d.comment: In accordance with common usage in geophysical disciplines, 'flux' implies per unit area, called 'flux density' in physics.  The specification of a physical process by the phrase due_to_process means that the quantity named is a  single term in a sum of terms which together compose the general quantity  named by omitting the phrase.  ' Iceberg thermodynamics' refers to the addition or subtraction of mass due to surface and basal fluxes, i.e., due to melting, sublimation and fusion.
hfibthermds2d.long_name: Heat Flux into Sea Water Due to Iceberg Thermodynamics

hflso.cell_methods: area: mean where ice_free_sea over sea time: mean
hflso.comment: This is defined as with the cell methods string: where ice_free_sea over sea

hfrainds.cell_methods: area: mean where ice_free_sea over sea time: mean
hfrainds.comment: This is defined as 'where ice_free_sea over sea'; i.e., the total flux (considered here) entering the ice-free portion of the grid cell divided by the area of the ocean portion of the grid cell.  All such heat fluxes are computed based on Celsius scale.
hfrainds.long_name: Temperature Flux Due to Rainfall Expressed as Heat Flux into Sea Water

hfrunoffds2d.cell_methods: area: mean where sea time: mean
hfrunoffds2d.comment: Heat flux associated with liquid water which drains from land. It is calculated relative to the heat that would be transported by runoff water entering the sea at zero degrees Celsius.
hfrunoffds2d.long_name: Temperature Flux Due to Runoff Expressed as Heat Flux into Sea Water

hfsifrazil2d.cell_methods: area: mean where sea time: mean
hfsifrazil2d.comment: In accordance with common usage in geophysical disciplines, 'flux' implies per unit area, called 'flux density' in physics. The specification of a physical process by the phrase due_to_process means that the quantity named is a single term in a sum of terms which together compose the general quantity named by omitting the phrase. 'Frazil' consists of needle like crystals of ice, typically between three and four millimeters in diameter, which form as sea water begins to freeze. Salt is expelled during the freezing process and frazil ice consists of nearly pure fresh water.
hfsifrazil2d.long_name: Heat Flux into Sea Water Due to Frazil Ice Formation

hfsnthermds2d.cell_methods: area: mean where sea time: mean
hfsnthermds2d.comment: In accordance with common usage in geophysical disciplines, 'flux' implies per unit area, called 'flux density' in physics.  The specification of a physical process by the phrase due_to_process means that the quantity named is a  single term in a sum of terms which together compose the general quantity  named by omitting the phrase.  'Snow thermodynamics' refers to the addition or subtraction of mass due to surface and basal fluxes, i.e., due to melting, sublimation and fusion.
hfsnthermds2d.long_name: Heat Flux into Sea Water Due to Snow Thermodynamics

hfsso.cell_methods: area: mean where ice_free_sea over sea time: mean
hfsso.comment: Downward sensible heat flux over sea ice free sea. The surface sensible heat flux, also called turbulent heat flux, is the exchange of heat between the surface and the air by motion of air.

hfx.cell_methods: area: mean where sea time: mean
hfx.comment: Contains all contributions to 'x-ward' heat transport from resolved and parameterized processes.  Use Celsius for temperature scale.

hfy.cell_methods: area: mean where sea time: mean
hfy.comment: Contains all contributions to 'y-ward' heat transport from resolved and parameterized processes. Use Celsius for temperature scale.

masso.cell_methods: area: sum where sea time: mean
masso.comment: Total mass of liquid sea water. For Boussinesq models, report this diagnostic as Boussinesq reference density times total volume.

mfo.comment: Transport across_line means that which crosses a particular line on the Earth's surface; formally this means the integral along the line of the normal component of the transport.

mlotst.cell_methods: area: mean where sea time: mean
mlotst.comment: Sigma T is potential density referenced to ocean surface.
mlotst.long_name: Ocean Mixed Layer Thickness Defined by Sigma T

mlotstmax.comment: Sigma T is potential density referenced to ocean surface.
mlotstmax.long_name: Maximum Ocean Mixed Layer Thickness Defined by Sigma T

mlotstmin.comment: Sigma T is potential density referenced to ocean surface.
mlotstmin.long_name: Minimum Ocean Mixed Layer Thickness Defined by Sigma T

mlotstsq.cell_methods: area: mean where sea time: mean
mlotstsq.comment: The phrase 'square_of_X' means X*X. The ocean mixed layer is the upper part of the ocean, regarded as being well-mixed. The base of the mixed layer defined by 'temperature', 'sigma', 'sigma_theta', 'sigma_t' or vertical diffusivity is the level at which the quantity indicated differs from its surface value by a certain amount. A coordinate variable or scalar coordinate variable with standard name sea_water_sigma_t_difference can be used to specify the sigma_t criterion that determines the layer thickness. Sigma-t of sea water is the density of water at atmospheric pressure (i.e. the surface) having the same temperature and salinity, minus 1000 kg m-3. 'Thickness' means the vertical extent of a layer.
mlotstsq.long_name: Square of Ocean Mixed Layer Thickness Defined by Sigma T

msftbarot.cell_methods: area: mean where sea time: mean
msftbarot.comment: Streamfunction or its approximation for free surface models. See OMDP document for details.

msftyrho.comment: Overturning mass streamfunction arising from all advective mass transport processes, resolved and parameterized.

msftyrhompa.comment: CMIP5 called this 'due to Bolus Advection'.  Name change respects the more general physics of the mesoscale parameterizations.
msftyrhompa.long_name: Ocean Y Overturning Mass Streamfunction Due to Parameterized Mesoscale Advection

ocontempmint.cell_methods: area: mean where sea time: mean
ocontempmint.comment: Full column sum of density*cell thickness*conservative temperature. If the model is Boussinesq, then use Boussinesq reference density for the density factor.
ocontempmint.long_name: Depth Integral of Product of Sea Water Density and Conservative Temperature

opottempmint.cell_methods: area: mean where sea time: mean
opottempmint.comment: Integral over the full ocean depth of the product of sea water density and potential temperature.
opottempmint.long_name: Integral with Respect to Depth of Product of Sea Water Density and Potential Temperature

pbo.cell_methods: area: mean where sea time: mean
pbo.comment: 'Sea water pressure' is the pressure that exists in the medium of sea water.  It includes the pressure due to overlying sea water, sea ice, air and any other medium that may be present.
pbo.long_name: Sea Water Pressure at Sea Floor

prsn.cell_methods: area: mean where ice_free_sea over sea time: mean
prsn.comment: At surface; includes precipitation of all forms of water in the solid phase
prsn.long_name: Snowfall Flux where Ice Free Ocean over Sea

pso.cell_methods: area: mean where sea time: mean
pso.comment: The surface called 'surface' means the lower boundary of the atmosphere.  'Sea water pressure' is the pressure that exists in the medium of sea water.  It includes the pressure due to overlying sea water, sea ice, air and any other medium that may be present.
pso.long_name: Sea Water Pressure at Sea Water Surface

rlntds.cell_methods: area: mean where ice_free_sea over sea time: mean
rlntds.comment: This is defined as 'where ice_free_sea over sea'

rsntds.cell_methods: area: mean where sea time: mean
rsntds.comment: This is the flux into the surface of liquid sea water only. This excludes shortwave flux absorbed by sea ice, but includes any light that passes through the ice and is absorbed by the ocean.
rsntds.long_name: Net Downward Shortwave Radiation at Sea Water Surface

sfdsi.cell_methods: area: mean where sea time: mean
sfdsi.comment: This field is physical, and it arises since sea ice has a nonzero salt content, so it exchanges salt with the liquid ocean upon melting and freezing.
sfdsi.long_name: Downward Sea Ice Basal Salt Flux

sfriver.cell_methods: area: mean where sea time: mean
sfriver.comment: This field is physical, and it arises when rivers carry a nonzero salt content.  Often this is zero, with rivers assumed to be fresh.
sfriver.long_name: Salt Flux into Sea Water from Rivers

sob.cell_methods: area: mean where sea time: mean
sob.comment: Model prognostic salinity at bottom-most model grid cell
sob.long_name: Sea Water Salinity at Sea Floor

soga.cell_methods: area: mean where sea time: mean
soga.comment: Sea water salinity is the salt content of sea water, often on the Practical Salinity Scale of 1978. However, the unqualified term 'salinity' is generic and does not necessarily imply any particular method of calculation. The units of salinity are dimensionless and the units attribute should normally be given as 1e-3 or 0.001 i.e. parts per thousand.

somint.cell_methods: area: mean where sea time: mean
somint.comment: Full column sum of density*cell thickness*prognostic salinity. If the model is Boussinesq, then use Boussinesq reference density for the density factor.
somint.long_name: Depth Integral of Product of Sea Water Density and Prognostic Salinity

sos.cell_methods: area: mean where sea time: mean
sos.comment: Sea water salinity is the salt content of sea water, often on the Practical Salinity Scale of 1978. However, the unqualified term 'salinity' is generic and does not necessarily imply any particular method of calculation. The units of salinity are dimensionless and the units attribute should normally be given as 1e-3 or 0.001 i.e. parts per thousand.

sosga.cell_methods: area: mean where sea time: mean
sosga.comment: Sea water salinity is the salt content of sea water, often on the Practical Salinity Scale of 1978. However, the unqualified term 'salinity' is generic and does not necessarily imply any particular method of calculation. The units of salinity are dimensionless and the units attribute should normally be given as 1e-3 or 0.001 i.e. parts per thousand.

sossq.cell_methods: area: mean where sea time: mean
sossq.comment: Sea water salinity is the salt content of sea water, often on the Practical Salinity Scale of 1978. However, the unqualified term 'salinity' is generic and does not necessarily imply any particular method of calculation. The units of salinity are dimensionless and the units attribute should normally be given as 1e-3 or 0.001 i.e. parts per thousand.

t20d.cell_methods: area: mean where sea time: mean
t20d.comment: This quantity, sometimes called the 'isotherm depth', is the depth (if it exists) at which the sea water potential temperature equals some specified value. This value should be specified in a scalar coordinate variable. Depth is the vertical distance below the surface. Potential temperature is the temperature a parcel of air or sea water would have if moved adiabatically to sea level pressure.

tauucorr.comment: This is the stress on the liquid ocean from overlying atmosphere, sea ice, ice shelf, etc.

tauuo.comment: This is the stress on the liquid ocean from overlying atmosphere, sea ice, ice shelf, etc.
tauuo.long_name: Sea Water Surface Downward X Stress

tauvcorr.comment: This is the stress on the liquid ocean from overlying atmosphere, sea ice, ice shelf, etc.

tauvo.comment: This is the stress on the liquid ocean from overlying atmosphere, sea ice, ice shelf, etc.
tauvo.long_name: Sea Water Surface Downward Y Stress

thetaoga.cell_methods: area: mean where sea time: mean
thetaoga.comment: Diagnostic should be contributed even for models using conservative temperature as prognostic field
thetaoga.long_name: Global Average Sea Water Potential Temperature

thetaot.comment: Vertical average of the sea water potential temperature through the whole ocean depth
thetaot.long_name: Vertically Averaged Sea Water Potential Temperature

thetaot2000.long_name: Depth Average Potential Temperature of Upper 2000m

thetaot300.long_name: Depth Average Potential Temperature of Upper 300m

thetaot700.long_name: Depth Average Potential Temperature of Upper 700m

tob.cell_methods: area: mean where sea time: mean
tob.comment: Potential temperature at the ocean bottom-most grid cell.
tob.long_name: Sea Water Potential Temperature at Sea Floor

tos.cell_methods: area: mean where sea time: mean
tos.comment: Temperature of upper boundary of the liquid ocean, including temperatures below sea-ice and floating ice shelves.

tosga.cell_methods: area: mean where sea time: mean
tosga.comment: Temperature of upper boundary of the liquid ocean, including temperatures below sea-ice and floating ice shelves.

tossq.cell_methods: area: mean where sea time: mean
tossq.comment: Square of temperature of liquid ocean.

volo.cell_methods: area: sum where sea time: mean
volo.comment: Total volume of liquid sea water.

vsf.cell_methods: area: mean where sea time: mean
vsf.comment: It is set to zero in models which receive a real water flux.
vsf.long_name: Virtual Salt Flux into Sea Water

vsfcorr.cell_methods: area: mean where sea time: mean
vsfcorr.comment: It is set to zero in models which receive a real water flux.

vsfevap.cell_methods: area: mean where sea time: mean
vsfevap.comment: zero for models using real water fluxes.
vsfevap.long_name: Virtual Salt Flux into Sea Water Due to Evaporation

vsfpr.cell_methods: area: mean where sea time: mean
vsfpr.comment: zero for models using real water fluxes.
vsfpr.long_name: Virtual Salt Flux into Sea Water Due to Rainfall

vsfriver.cell_methods: area: mean where sea time: mean
vsfriver.comment: zero for models using real water fluxes.
vsfriver.long_name: Virtual Salt Flux into Sea Water from Rivers

vsfsit.cell_methods: area: mean where sea time: mean
vsfsit.comment: This variable measures the virtual salt flux into sea water due to the melting of sea ice. It is set to zero in models which receive a real water flux.
vsfsit.long_name: Virtual Salt Flux into Sea Water Due to Sea Ice Thermodynamics

wfcorr.cell_methods: area: mean where sea time: mean
wfcorr.comment: Computed as the water flux into the ocean due to flux correction divided by the area of the ocean portion of the grid cell.

wfo.cell_methods: area: mean where sea time: mean
wfo.comment: Computed as the water flux into the ocean divided by the area of the ocean portion of the grid cell. This is the sum *wfonocorr* and *wfcorr*.

wfonocorr.cell_methods: area: mean where sea time: mean
wfonocorr.comment: Computed as the water flux (without flux correction) into the ocean divided by the area of the ocean portion of the grid cell.
wfonocorr.long_name: Water Flux into Sea Water Without Flux Correction

zos.cell_methods: area: mean where sea time: mean
zos.comment: This is the dynamic sea level, so should have zero global area mean. It should not include inverse barometer depressions from sea ice.

zossq.cell_methods: area: mean where sea time: mean
zossq.long_name: Square of Sea Surface Height Above Geoid

zostoga.cell_methods: area: mean where sea time: mean
zostoga.comment: There is no CMIP6 request for zosga nor zossga.
zostoga.long_name: Global Average Thermosteric Sea Level Change
